revised_title: Optimization Techniques in Trace Atomic Spectroscopy
semantic_tags: Inductively Coupled Plasma Atomic Emission Spectrometry
tldr: The article discusses the importance of optimization in trace atomic spectroscopy, focusing on the use of variable step-size simplex algorithms to improve analytical instrumentation. The authors highlight the benefits of this optimization technique, such as speed, computer compatibility, and the ability to minimize interferences. They also provide examples of successful optimizations in inductively coupled plasma atomic emission spectrometry (ICP-AES), slurry atomization, hydride generation, and inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (ICP-MS).
